result.execSummary:
The defendant Malcolm L Haskins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Malcolm L Haskins is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Malcolm L Haskins was found guilty of Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine in the amount of $5,000.00 inclusive of all mandatory costs, victim witness, DNA surcharges. Bail to apply.  Balance to be collected by DOC from 25% of prison funds. Balance to be paid by 12/29/14.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

Provide DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Malcolm L Haskins in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Defendant Malcolm L Haskins in custody.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant.

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for FIVE  YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of THREE  YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of TWO YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 24 days.
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

-Court  ORDERED A FINE IN THE AMOUNT OF $5000.00 INCLUSIVE OF ALL MANDATORY costs and victim/witness  DNA surcharges , DNA SAMPLE , FROM BAIL ON DEPOSIT AND ANY BALANCE TO  be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 12-29-14; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Defendant is remanded.

Attorney Christopher Lee Hartley in court, defendant Malcolm L Haskins not in court, in custody.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel waives his client's appearance.  Parties request a brief adjournment.  File retained in court.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 30, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Justice point report received and filed. lr
Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47. Same bail. Defense counsel at a funeral.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 10-21-2014 at 01:30 pm.
Attorney Christopher Lee Hartley in court VIA SPEAKER PHONE, defendant Malcolm L Haskins not in court, in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47. lr  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 10-16-2014 at 01:30 pm.
On motion of the State, Court increased the bail to  a total of  $25,000 cash. Previous bail is NOT forfeited. Defendant taken into custody.

Defendant Malcolm L Haskins in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.


As to Count ONE: 

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

On motion of the STATE, Court ordered Counts TWO and THREE:  DISMISSED. 

Jury in box. Court released the jurors.

By motion of Both parties Court ordered all exhibits withdrawn to the proferring parties forthwith.

Defendant Malcolm L Haskins in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  10:49am.  Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered. Jury out of box. Jury in box.   Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Officer Lee Vedbraaten. Exhibits 2,3,5,1,4 marked. Sworn in for the state:  Officer Richard Jacobs. Exhibit 6 marked. Officer Michael Wawrzyniakowski sworn in. Exhibits 3, 2,4, 8, 9 ,5 received.  Jury out of box. Jury in box. Still sworn for the State: Officer M. Wawrzyniakowski. Exhibits 10 and 11, 7, 14,12,13,1 received. Exhibits 15,16,17,18,19,20,21 received.. Exhibit 22 marked.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box.  Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court.  Jury in the box. Jury out of box at 4:45pm.

Defendant Malcolm L Haskins in court.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel, Christopher Hartley, phoned the court stating he is ill.  Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 47.  Jury trial scheduled for 10-08-2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice point report received and filed. lr
Defense filed witness list; motion in limine; jury instructions. lr
Amended  Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Case remains on for jury trial to Br. 47. Same bail. lr

Defendant Malcolm L Haskins in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State filed an Amended Information adding Counts TWO: Possession of a firearm by a felon pursuant to sec. 941.29(2)(a),939.50(3)(g) and Count Three: Possession of a firearm by a felon pursuant to sec  941.29(2)(a), 939.50(3)(g).
Bail Notice/Affidavit mailed to surety on 05/23/14. AR
Court amends bail to $4000, $3500 to be refunded.

Defendant Malcolm L Haskins in court with attorney Christopher L Hartley.  Karyn E Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court grants defense motion to reduce bail.  Case remains calendared for motion hearing and final pre-trial on 08/14/2014 in Branch 15.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Notice of Motion for Modification of Bond received and filed.  Bail hearing scheduled for 05/22/2014.

Defendant Malcolm L Haskins in court with attorney Christopher L Hartley.  Karyn E Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for MOTION HEARING/FINAL PRETRIAL on 8/14/2014 at 8:30 am and JURY TRIAL on 9/8/2014 at 9:00 am. Pretrial Scheduling Order signed and filed.   Parties advised effective August 2, 2014, this case will be reassigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47, Room 635 of the Courthouse.

Defendant Malcolm L Haskins in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Karyn E. Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defense just received the rest of the discovery on todays date. Case calendared for STATUS on 4/23/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Malcolm L Haskins in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Karyn E. Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defense just received the police reports and needs time to review them. Case calendared for STATUS on 4/10/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Court enters a not guilty on behalf of the defendant.

Defendant Malcolm L Haskins in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Kevin R. Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Watts, Br. 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 20, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 3/7/14.
